intro: Pavetta bruneelii, commonly known as the New Zealand pavetta, is a small evergreen shrub native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant features simple, alternate leaves that are typically elliptical or ovate in shape. It produces small, white to pale pink flowers that are clustered in cymes, followed by red, fleshy berries. Pavetta bruneelii is often found in coastal and lowland habitats, thriving in well-drained soils.
